info.title: IBM IoT Blockchain Elevator Contract API
info.description: Interact with the API and schema for IoT Blockchain Elevator contract. Based on the CRUD contract pattern, which is implemented as a pseudo-RPC payload in the chain code inputs (function string and args string array) of the deploy, invoke and query end points. Similar in concept to a JSON-RPC encoding. Note that the interface shown in this schema defines the chaincode inputs as an array of objects, but those objects are always in fact a single JSON encoded string. The sections before Definitions are redacted versions of the rest_api.json file in the Open Block Chain project. This schema builds on the paths by defining the payloads for the devops resource APIs. This file can be explored in the Swagger GUI, but it throws an error on the choice verb 'oneOf', which is very useful for defining payloads related to one endpoint, such as query. This schema uses references everywhere to avoid data duplication, but the generate command runs a script that can resolve all references and create a schema with all data fully realized.

post.description: The /chaincode endpoint receives requests to deploy, invoke, and query a target Chaincode. This service endpoint implements the JSON RPC 2.0 specification with the payload identifying the desired Chaincode operation within the 'method' field.

jsonrpc.description: A string specifying the version of the JSON-RPC protocol. Must be exactly '2.0'.

method.description: the command's service endpoint for deployment, invocation or query

params.description: A required Chaincode specification message identifying the target chaincode.

id.description: An integer number used to correlate the request and response objects. If it is not included, the request is assumed to be a notification and the server will not generate a response.

ctorMsg.description: Specific function to execute within the Chaincode.

path.description: Chaincode location in the file system. This value is required by the deploy transaction.

name.description: Chaincode name identifier. This value is required by the invoke and query transactions.

ChaincodeInput.description: the payload for a deploy, invoke or query message

ChaincodeInputDeploy.description: the payload for a deploy message

ChaincodeInputInvoke.description: the payload for an invoke message

ChaincodeInputQuery.description: the payload for a query message

Status.description: A string confirming successful request execution.

Message.description: Additional information about the response or values returned.

code.description: A number that indicates the error type that occurred.

message.description: A string providing a short description of the error.

data.default: Error unmarshalling chaincode request payload: unexpected end of JSON input
data.description: A primitive or structured value that contains additional information about the error (e.g. detailed error information, nested errors etc.).

API.description: The API for the Elevator sample contract consisting of the init function, the crud functions to change state, and a set of query functions for asset state, asset history, recent states, and so on.

init.description: Initializes the contract when started, either by deployment or by peer restart.

createAsset.description: Create an asset. One argument, a JSON encoded event. AssetID is required with zero or more writable properties. Establishes an initial asset state.

updateAsset.description: Update the state of an asset. The one argument is a JSON encoded event. AssetID is required along with one or more writable properties. Establishes the next asset state.

deleteAsset.description: Delete an asset, its history, and any recent state activity. Argument is a JSON encoded string containing only an assetID.

deletePropertiesFromAsset.description: Delete one or more properties from an asset. Argument is a JSON encoded string containing an AssetID and an array of qualified property names. An example would be {'assetID':'A1',['event.common.carrier', 'event.customer.temperature']} and the result of that invoke would be the removal of the carrier field and the temperature field with a recalculation of the alert and compliance status.

deleteAllAssets.description: Delete the state of all assets. No arguments are accepted. For each managed asset, the state and history are erased, and the asset is removed if necessary from recent states.

readAsset.description: Returns the state an asset. Argument is a JSON encoded string. AssetID is the only accepted property.

readAllAssets.description: Returns the state of all assets as an array of JSON encoded strings. Accepts no arguments. For each managed asset, the state is read from the ledger and added to the returned array. Array is sorted by assetID.

readAssetHistory.description: Requests a specified number of history states for an assets. Returns an array of states sorted with the most recent first. AssetID is required and count is optional. A missing count, a count of zero, or too large a count returns all existing history states.

readAssetSchemas.description: Returns a string generated from the schema containing APIs and Objects as specified in generate.json in the scripts folder.

result.description: JSON encoded object containing selected schemas

readAssetSamples.description: Returns a string generated from the schema containing sample Objects as specified in generate.json in the scripts folder.

result.description: JSON encoded object containing selected sample data

readRecentStates.description: Returns the state of recently updated assets as an array of objects sorted with the most recently updated asset first. Each asset appears exactly once up to a maxmum of 20 in this version of the contract.

readContractState.description: Returns the state of the contract, which includes its version, its nickname and a list of assetIDs that are currently managed.

setLoggingLevel.description: Sets the logging level in the contract.

args.description: logging levels indicate what you see

setCreateOnUpdate.description: Allow updateAsset to redirect to createAsset when assetID does not exist.

args.description: True for redirect allowed, false for error on asset does not exist.

jsonrpc.description: A string specifying the version of the JSON-RPC protocol. Must be exactly '2.0'.

result.description: The value of this element is determined by the method invoked on the server.

id.description: This number will be the same as the value of the id member in the request object.

jsonrpc.description: A string specifying the version of the JSON-RPC protocol. Must be exactly '2.0'.

error.description: A structured value specifying the code and description of the error that occurred.

id.description: This number will be the same as the value of the id member in the request object. If there was an error detecting the id in the request object (e.g. Parse error/Invalid Request), it will be null.

version.description: The version number of the current contract

nickname.description: The nickname of the current contract

assetID.description: The ID of a managed asset. The resource focal point for a smart contract.

assetIDKey.description: An object containing only an assetID for use as an argument to read or delete.

alertName.description: Alerts are triggered or cleared by rules that are run against incoming events. This contract considers any active alert to created a state of non-compliance.

alertStatus.description: Active means that the alert is in force in this state. Raised means that the alert became active as the result of the event that generated this state. Cleared means that the alert became inactive as the result of the event that generated this state.

items.description: The qualified name of a property. E.g. 'event.common.carrier', 'event.custom.temperature', etc.

assetIDandPropertyArray.description: Requested assetID with a list or qualified property names.

eventWithFunction.description: function and string parameter that created this state object

items.description: parameters to the function, usually args[0] is populated with a JSON encoded event object

function.description: function that created this state object

redirectedFromFunction.description: function that originally received the event

initEvent.description: event sent to init on deployment

event.description: A set of fields that constitute the writable fields in an asset's state. AssetID is mandatory along with at least one writable field. In this contract pattern, a partial state is used as an event.

assetID.description: The ID of a managed asset. The resource focal point for a smart contract.

weight.description: Weight of the Asset in Lb

system.description: Properties of micro computer installed in the elevator

temperature.description: Temperature of the asset in FAHRENHEIT.

speed.description: Speed of the asset in feet/second.

power.description: Power consumption by the asset in KwH.

state.description: A set of fields that constitute the complete asset state.

assetID.description: The ID of a managed asset. The resource focal point for a smart contract.

weight.description: Weight of the Asset in Lb

system.description: Properties of micro computer installed in the elevator

temperature.description: Temperature of the asset in FAHRENHEIT.

speed.description: Speed of the asset in feet/second.

power.description: Power consumption by the asset in KwH.

stateArray.description: an array of states, often for different assets

stateArrayRecentFirst.description: an array of states for one asset sorted by timestamp with the most recent entry first

activeAssets.description: array containing actively managed asset IDs
